repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
This reduces the _build time_ required luarocks packages to zero. (luarocks is now only needed for testing).

alternative: vendor lpeg as `src/lpeg` just like `src/mpack`. This avoids most extra cmake code, but vendors the lpeg c code (~5000 lines). Not sure which one will make distros recoil in horror the most.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
`vim.lpeg`. In addition, its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re`.
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -648,6 +648,13 @@ regex:match_line({bufnr}, {line_idx} [, {start}, {end}])  *regex:match_line()*
     |regex:match_str()|. If {start} is used, then the returned byte indices
     will be relative {start}.
 
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+VIM.LPEG                                                            *lua-lpeg*
+
+                                                             *vim.lpeg* *vim.re*
+The Lpeg library for parsing expression grammars is being included as
+`vim.lpeg`. In additional its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re`.

comment_data.body:
```suggestion
`vim.lpeg` (https://www.inf.puc-rio.br/~roberto/lpeg/). In addition, its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re` (https://www.inf.puc-rio.br/~roberto/lpeg/re.html).
```

Or do we want to vendor that as well?
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -648,6 +648,13 @@ regex:match_line({bufnr}, {line_idx} [, {start}, {end}])  *regex:match_line()*
     |regex:match_str()|. If {start} is used, then the returned byte indices
     will be relative {start}.
 
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+VIM.LPEG                                                            *lua-lpeg*
+
+                                                             *vim.lpeg* *vim.re*
+The Lpeg library for parsing expression grammars is being included as
+`vim.lpeg`. In addition, its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re`.

@@ -160,27 +160,21 @@ foreach(CFGNAME ${CMAKE_CONFIGURATION_TYPES})
   set(CMAKE_ARCHIVE_OUTPUT_DIRECTORY_${CFGNAME} ${CMAKE_BINARY_DIR}/lib)
 endforeach()
 
-set(LUA_DEPENDENCIES lpeg)
 if(NOT LUA_PRG)
   foreach(CURRENT_LUA_PRG luajit lua5.1 lua5.2 lua)
     unset(_CHECK_LUA_PRG CACHE)
     unset(LUA_PRG_WORKS)

@@ -0,0 +1,22 @@
+# TODO: these two from BuildLuv, deduplicate
+set(LPEG_INCLUDE_FLAGS
+  "-I${DEPS_INSTALL_DIR}/include -I${DEPS_INSTALL_DIR}/include/luajit-2.1")
+list(APPEND LPEG_CMAKE_ARGS
+  "-DCMAKE_C_FLAGS:STRING=${LPEG_INCLUDE_FLAGS}")
+
+ExternalProject_Add(lpeg
+  URL ${LPEG_URL}
+  URL_HASH SHA256=${LPEG_SHA256}
+  DOWNLOAD_NO_PROGRESS TRUE
+  DOWNLOAD_DIR ${DEPS_DOWNLOAD_DIR}/lpeg
+  PATCH_COMMAND ${CMAKE_COMMAND} -E copy
+    ${CMAKE_CURRENT_SOURCE_DIR}/cmake/LpegCMakeLists.txt
+    ${DEPS_BUILD_DIR}/src/lpeg/CMakeLists.txt
+    CMAKE_ARGS ${DEPS_CMAKE_ARGS} ${LPEG_CMAKE_ARGS}

@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+find_library(LPEG_LIBRARY NAMES lpeg_a lpeg liblpeg_a)
+
+# Ubuntu-specific workaround to find system paths
+function(ubuntu)
+  set(CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_PREFIXES "")
+  find_library(LPEG_LIBRARY NAMES lpeg PATH_SUFFIXES lua/5.1)
+endfunction()
+ubuntu()
+
+message(STATUS "KRARK")
+message(STATUS "${LPEG_LIBRARY}")

@@ -0,0 +1,14 @@
+find_library(LPEG_LIBRARY NAMES lpeg_a lpeg liblpeg_a)
+
+# Ubuntu-specific workaround to find system paths
+function(ubuntu)
+  set(CMAKE_FIND_LIBRARY_PREFIXES "")
+  find_library(LPEG_LIBRARY NAMES lpeg PATH_SUFFIXES lua/5.1)
+endfunction()
+ubuntu()
+
+message(STATUS "KRARK")
+message(STATUS "${LPEG_LIBRARY}")
+
+find_package_handle_standard_args(Lpeg DEFAULT_MSG LPEG_LIBRARY )

comment_data.body: STATIC isn't needed, we're installing all deps as STATIC by default.
maybe but it could be a followup. adding the links for now.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -648,6 +648,13 @@ regex:match_line({bufnr}, {line_idx} [, {start}, {end}])  *regex:match_line()*
     |regex:match_str()|. If {start} is used, then the returned byte indices
     will be relative {start}.
 
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+VIM.LPEG                                                            *lua-lpeg*
+
+                                                             *vim.lpeg* *vim.re*
+The Lpeg library for parsing expression grammars is being included as
+`vim.lpeg`. In addition, its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re`.

comment_data.body: (I looked at the docs; they're not huge, so pulling them in as `lua.txt` is perfectly feasible, and possibly useful -- depending on how useful `vim.lpeg` and `vim.re` is for users, of course. But as you say, possible followup, and good-first-issue.)
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -648,6 +648,13 @@ regex:match_line({bufnr}, {line_idx} [, {start}, {end}])  *regex:match_line()*
     |regex:match_str()|. If {start} is used, then the returned byte indices
     will be relative {start}.
 
+------------------------------------------------------------------------------
+VIM.LPEG                                                            *lua-lpeg*
+
+                                                             *vim.lpeg* *vim.re*
+The Lpeg library for parsing expression grammars is being included as
+`vim.lpeg`. In addition, its regex-like interface is available as `vim.re`.

comment_regular_data.body:
Do we want to make changes to `lpeg` for _any_ reason? That is usually the deciding factor on whether to vendor something.

On the other hand, would vendoring allow keeping `lpeg.lua` out of runtime (and hence the grubby mitts of `stylua`)? Vendoring would also be more robust against unreachable hosts (as `lpeg` seems to be hosted in the private user directory on a single university server).

labels.description: building and installing Neovim using the provided scripts
labels.name: build

labels.description: changes that are not features or bugfixes
labels.name: refactor

title: refactor(build): include lpeg as a library
